column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've had problems since I was 19 with severe diabilating pain every couple months, I'm now 29.  So severe, I couldn't leave the house let alone stand up, or function like a normal human being.  I have not been diagnosed with any particular disease.  Was prescribed this on a as needed basis, to take 1- 20mg tab every 15 min til the pain subsided. Where the side affects are horrendous, I would not trade the pain.  Side affects being, slurred speech, not comprehending speech or conversations, and constipation that lasts for 3 days. I would take the side affects over the pain any day. This medicine has let me at least not scare my children with the pain in my guts.  Though, I would not reccomend opperating heavy machinery or driving on this medication, you can still certainly still make dinner and tuck your kids into bed without screaming in pain and being taken to the hospital.  So far this is the only medicine that has helped my cause.  Thank you!

column2: Bentyl Boy, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My symptoms for IBS were constant diarrhea accompanied by gas. I often had diarrhea within a couple of hours of eating a meal and sometimes had it 4-6 times per day. I often didnt have time to make it to the toilet! I had gurgling in my bowels while I was having a bowel movement. Furthermore, fresh vegetables passed right through me. My doctor prescribed Bentyl 3 months ago. I took this med 3 times per day when I started. This caused constipation and pain in my lower abdomen. I cut my dose to twice per day and my bowels became relatively normal, but my stool was hard. My doctor added Metamucil to my regimen to regulate my bowels and soften my stool. The fiber in Metamucil has made my stool normal and has not caused diarrhea. Im now taking one Bentyl per day and using Metamucil once per day. My IBS is under control and I have one or two normal bowel movements a day.

column9: This medication has helped a lot with my stomach pain and cramping.  I have also noticed that it has helped restore function to my bowel. I take the medication 3 times a day, and I have noticed that if I forget to take my doses (the stomach pain and cramping has been greatly reduced since starting this med), I become slightly constipated (only for a day, day and a half).  Overall, this med has helped me a lot.

column9: I am 28 years old and when I was 20 years old, I was first started experiencing horrible constipation and painful bloating.  I was diagnosed with IBS and have used these every since. When I have a horrible, painful IBS attack (whether from gas, constipation, etc), taking this ALWAYS "numbs" my stomach pains.  Of course, they  need to be intestinal-related stomach pains.  There is nothing else that can help me.  It gets so bad sometimes that it feels like a knife is stabbing me in the lower left or right quadrant of my lower intestine.  Without these pills, I would have to miss work more often and would be in SEVERE pain for much, much longer.I HIGHLY recommend these! They have worked wonders for me! column2: ArkSteph, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have inflammatory bowel disease. Been taking this for a year now. I recently ran out and have not taken it for a few days. It helps the intestinal/colon related lower abdominal cramps and diarrhea. It does have slight side effects. It makes you feel a bit tired and maybe sort of in a bit of a haze but nothing serious. column2: pam, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: so far so good i had taken hyoscamine  for a long time but my insurance quit paying for  it, i only take this 30 min before i eat the largest meal of the day,instead of four times a day, it is helping my I.B,S,after reading some of your feedback it gave me some worry,i never take some meds exactly like the doctor says remember they are practicing medicine on you..and some people do not fit the clinical trials the doctor studied in school, of course you can not do that with some meds such as heart meds,blood thinners or diabetis medication,but with some meds that are not life or death situations a person can figure out how often they can take some meds,my doctor has me on xanex and his directions were 6 times a day, if i took it that way i could not drive or even get out of bed,so after reading some of these stories this is a drug i don't think i want in my blood stream at a constant leval..
